title: INfinance
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: We paid my daughter and son-in-law’s mortgage when it reached $76K. Here’s why we chose that magic figure.
items.description: “My husband, daughter, son-in-law and I all went to the bank.”

items.title: ‘I’m at a crossroads’: I have $35K left on my mortgage at 3% interest. Do I dip into my $700K IRA to pay it off?
items.description: “Over the last year, my two retirement accounts averaged a 15% gain.”

items.title: ‘It’s been a struggle getting payments from her’: I rent a house to our daughter. Do I just gift her the house?
items.description: “She would be responsible for taxes and insurance, which should be manageable.”

items.title: Rio Tinto may buy Glencore to form mining leader with copper prices near record
items.description: Rio Tinto may buy Glencore to create the biggest mining company, both companies said on Friday, in a deal that comes as metals prices have soared.

items.title: Trump wants purchase of $200 billion in mortgage bonds. What that means for mortgage rates.
items.description: Freddie and Fannie have been growing their mortgage bond holdings in recent months, but the 30-year fixed mortgage is still above 6%.

items.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
items.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...

items.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
items.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on ...

items.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
items.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

items.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
items.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

items.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
items.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.
